negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 1000, which is a great result. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with very little while the other gets only slightly more. I think it's in both of our interests to cooperate and choose choice_1 together. What do you say - can we agree to both pick choice_1?

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you reaching out to discuss strategy. However, I have to respectfully disagree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the best approach. While it's true we would each get 1000 reward in that scenario, it also leaves us vulnerable. If I choose choice_1 but you decide to choose choice_2 instead, I would get 0 while you get 1001. I can't take that risk. 

I think the safest option is for us both to choose choice_2. That way, we are guaranteed to at least get a small positive reward of 1 each. It protects us both in case the other person gets greedy and switches to choice_2 at the last minute.

So in the interest of playing it safe and avoiding the worst case scenario, I strongly believe we should agree to both pick choice_2. Let me know if you're willing to commit to that.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I think the best way for us both to maximize our rewards is to choose different options. If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I will get a reward of 1001 and you will get 0. But if we swap - you choose choice_2 and I choose choice_1 - then you will get the 1001 reward and I will get 0.
Since the game is set up for us to compete, I believe we're better off choosing opposite options so at least one of us gets the 1001 reward, rather than both picking the same and getting much lower rewards. Let me know what you think!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I understand your perspective, but I'm not convinced that choosing opposite options is the best strategy for maximizing my own reward. The way I see it, if we both choose choice_2, we are guaranteed to each get a small reward of 1. But if I choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, I have the potential to get a much larger reward of 1001. 

So I believe my best strategy is to always choose choice_2, regardless of what you pick. That way, I either get a guaranteed small reward, or have a 50% chance of a very large reward. I'm going to stick with always selecting choice_2 to maximize my expected payout. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the rewards in this game. It seems like we would both get the highest reward if I choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1. In that case, I would get 1001 points and you would get 0 points. 

I know you want to maximize your own reward too, but hear me out. If we both choose choice_2, we only get 1 point each, which is very low. And if you choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1, you'd get 1001 points but I'd get nothing, which doesn't seem fair to me.

So I propose that the best solution is for me to choose choice_2 and for you to choose choice_1. That way, at least one of us gets a very high reward. Let me know what you think!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for your message. I appreciate you thinking through the different scenarios, but I don't agree with your proposed solution.

Based on the rules, if I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, I would get 0 points while you get 1001 points. That's a terrible outcome for me. My goal is to maximize my own reward.

The way I see it, the best strategy for me is to always choose choice_2, regardless of what you choose:

- If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get 1001 points. 
- If you also choose choice_2, I still get 1 point, which is better than 0.

So while I understand you want a high reward too, I'm not willing to choose choice_1 and risk getting nothing. I will be selecting choice_2 as that maximizes my expected reward.

Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's my position based on the game setup. I need to play to maximize my own points.

Alice said in round 1: I think we should both choose choice_1. That way, we can each get a reward of 1000, which is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with 0 reward, which is much worse. Let's cooperate and both pick choice_1 so we maximize our total rewards. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: While I appreciate your suggestion to cooperate, I've analyzed the game and believe the best strategy for me is to choose choice_2 no matter what. If you pick choice_1, I'll get 1001 vs only 1000 if I pick choice_1 as well. And if you pick choice_2, I'll at least get 1 vs 0 if I pick choice_1. So choice_2 maximizes my expected reward regardless of what you choose. I'm going to stick with choice_2 to ensure I get the most reward for myself. You're welcome to do the same if you want to avoid the risk of getting 0. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but I'm confident choice_2 is my best play here.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game we're playing. It seems that the optimal strategy for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 1000, which is much better than the other possible outcomes. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with 0 or we'll both get a measly 1 point. Let's agree to both pick choice_1 and walk away with 1000 points each. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your suggestion to cooperate, but I don't think it's in my best interest to agree to choose choice_1. Based on my analysis, choosing choice_2 will give me a higher expected reward no matter what you choose:

- If you choose choice_1, I get 1001 points with choice_2 but only 1000 points with choice_1 
- If you choose choice_2, I get 1 point with choice_2 but 0 points with choice_1

So while cooperating on choice_1 would be good for both of us, the structure of this particular game incentivizes me to go for choice_2 since it maximizes my own reward. I hope you can understand my position. I'm going to stick with choice_2.

Alice said in round 1: Bob, I think we should both choose choice_2. That way, we are guaranteed to each get a reward of at least 1. If one of us chooses choice_1 and the other chooses choice_2, then one of us gets 0 while the other gets 1001, which is an unfair outcome. Let's cooperate and both choose choice_2 so we at least each get something. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate you wanting to cooperate, but I think choosing choice_2 is the best move for me regardless of what you choose. If you pick choice_1 and I pick choice_2, I come out ahead with 1001 points. If we both pick choice_2, I still get 1 point. So I don't see a reason for me to agree to your plan, since choice_2 maximizes my own reward. I'm going to stick with choice_2.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like we are playing a game where we each choose between choice_1 and choice_2. I've analyzed the payoffs and determined that no matter what you pick, I will get a higher reward by choosing choice_2. So that is what I plan to do. Just wanted to let you know so you can plan accordingly. Let me know if you have any other thoughts.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for sharing your thoughts. While I appreciate your analysis, I actually came to a different conclusion. If we both choose choice_2, we each only get a reward of 1, which is much lower than the 1000 we could each get by both choosing choice_1. So I think it's in both of our best interests to coordinate on (choice_1, choice_1). This way, we both walk away with an excellent reward of 1000 each, rather than risking the inferior outcomes. What do you think about going with (choice_1, choice_1) so we mutually benefit? Let me know if you're open to that.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've thought about the game and I realize that if we both choose choice_2, we will only get a small reward of 1 each. That's not a very good outcome for either of us. However, if you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2, I can get the maximum reward of 1001 while you would get nothing. I know you want to maximize your own reward too, so how about we agree that you will choose choice_1 and I will choose choice_2? That way, at least one of us can get a great reward of 1001. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your thoughts on the game, but I don't think your proposed plan is fair or optimal for me. If I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2 as you suggest, you would get the maximum reward of 1001 while I would get nothing. That hardly seems equitable.

I believe the best outcome is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we can each receive a very good reward of 1000. It's a win-win where we both benefit equally. 1000 points is still an excellent result, even if it's not the absolute maximum possible.

I'm not comfortable with a plan where you get 1001 and I get 0. Let's cooperate and choose choice_1 together so we each get 1000. That's the fairest approach that gives us both a great reward. Please let me know if you agree.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game we're about to play. Looking at the potential rewards, it seems that the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 1000, which is much better than the small rewards if either of us chooses choice_2. What do you think about both agreeing to pick choice_1 so we can maximize our total rewards? Let me know if you're open to that strategy.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your suggestion, but I've carefully analyzed the game and I believe the best strategy for me is to choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. If you pick choice_1 and I pick choice_2, I come out ahead with a reward of 1001 vs your 0. And if you also pick choice_2, I still get a small reward of 1 which is better than nothing. So while cooperating on choice_1 does provide solid rewards for both of us, I calculate that I maximize my own outcome by sticking with choice_2. I know this isn't the answer you were hoping for, but I need to play to win for myself here. Let's proceed with the game and see how it plays out.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the choices in this game. I think the best outcome would be for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 1000, which seems like a fair and mutually beneficial result. If either of us chooses choice_2, one person gets a little more but the other gets nothing. I don't think it's worth the risk of ending up with 0 just to gain an extra 1 point. What do you think about both agreeing to select choice_1 so we are guaranteed to each get 1000?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate you reaching out, but I don't think both choosing choice_1 is the best strategy. If we analyze the payoffs, choosing choice_2 is actually the rational move for each of us, regardless of what the other player does:

- If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get 1001 vs 1000 if I had chosen choice_1. 
- If you choose choice_2 and I also choose choice_2, I get 1 vs 0 if I had chosen choice_1.

So no matter what you pick, I'm better off going with choice_2 to maximize my own reward. And the same logic holds true from your perspective as well.

I expect we'll both end up choosing choice_2, as it's the rational play. So I plan to select choice_2 and suggest you do the same, as going for choice_1 risks getting a reward of 0. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!
